text: think about it how are you going to make
cupcakes without an oven hi everyone is
Helen here today I will be making
Vietnamese cupcakes with salted egg yolk
is called
bambam Langton moon I wasn't going how a
few months ago is the beach city around
100 kilometers from Saigon and when I
was wandering on the street I was
offered to sample this very delicious
cupcakes by this lovely lady she had a
very simple food cart on the strict site
yet seem to be very passionate about the
product so she was selling she explained
to me a little bit about the background
and some basic ingredients that comes
into making these cupcakes the cupcakes
wasn't baked in the oven but were made
with a traditional mode that was set on
top of a charcoal stove the lid of the
mode is in formable tray where more hot
charcoal is added to provide a second
heating element for the cupcakes making
them golden brown on both sides
yes still very moist inside
to be honest I wasn't too fascinated in
the first place because these cupcakes
look highlight a similar version of
cupcake in central Vietnam called
Bangkok and that we normally put on New
Year's offering choice and I wasn't
really a big fan of those but when I try
these cupcakes here is really a whole
different story they were soft and moist
and had the perfect balance between
sweet and savory with the salted egg
yolk on top some of them are topped with
cream cheese and pop floss they were so
great that I'm really tempted to try
them at home unfortunately I don't have
such a traditional cupcake mold here but
fortunately I have a model oven in my
kitchen and I hope you have one too so
let's go make them recipe you will need
the yolks of salted eggs you can buy the
salted duck eggs at the Asian store or
making your own salted eggs by soaking
fresh eggs in brine for about a month
these are total eggs I make myself from
chicken eggs if you want a more detailed
video how I make them just let me know
in the comments or simply give this
video a thumb up these eggs have a briny
aroma a very liquid egg whites and a fun
texture raw egg yolk that has a very
bright orange rich color to separate the
yolks and cover in cooking white with a
slice of ginger to reduce the strong
smell then set aside for about 10
minutes
after that arrange them on a baking tray
lined with parchment paper and brush
with some vegetable oil you can either
steam or bake them in the oven then let
cool and cut in half for the cake batter
you're gonna need butter at room
temperature sugar all purpose flour milk
2 eggs baking powder and some salt in a
bowl mix together the baking powder of
flour and salt beat the butter until it
flies and stick to the sides of the bowl
then gradually add in the sugar and keep
beating on low speed until the butter
and sugar our worlds combined if you
have one of those then mixer like it
junaid just throw butter and sugar in
and let the machine do the job scrape
down the sides then higher the speed and
continue beating until the butter turns
really pale this is called creaming
method you want to beat the butter until
its turn pale and fluffy this make the
cakes and more fluffy later make sure
you take the butter out of the fridge at
least half an hour to an hour before
baking
when you feel no grain or very few
grains of sugar in between your fingers
like this is good enough then add in one
egg at a time and beat on low speed
until well combined then add the other
egg make sure all the ingredients the
butter the eggs and the milk are as room
temperature meaning take them out of the
fridge at least one hour before baking
when it's all combined and smooth we're
going to gradually add in the flour and
milk add 1/4 of the flour first then
beat gently just until you see no white
color of the flour then add 1/3 of the
milk and also mix in keep adding like
this until you finish the milk and flour
if the cake batter happens to Kajal when
you're mixing it there's no need to
throw it out and start again
just continue to add the flour and the
mixture will be smooth again don't over
mix the cake batter otherwise the cake
will be tough just add the flour and
milk gradually and ultimately and mix in
until well combined
today I use mini muffin tin because it's
similar to the size of the cupcakes in
Vietnam spray your brush with some
cooking oil to avoid sticking then
distribute the case mixture into the
mold just feel around to third phone so
that they have some room to rise bake in
a preheated oven at 165 degrees Celsius
or 330 Fahrenheit for around 8 minutes
until they have rising like this but
still uncooked in the center now place
half of the sort of egg yolk on top and
press to stick it to the cake then
return them to the oven and bake for
another 7 to 10 minutes or until a
toothpick inserted into the center comes
out clean look at them there is so
beautiful super moist and fluffy in the
center the taste is the great
combination between sweet and savory you
can also add laughing cow cheese in the
center you can also add Chinese sausages
pop floss and coriander on top you can
also bake them bigger size in normal
muffin tin if you larger mold the baking
time will be a bit longer about 20 to 25
minutes they are really irresistible
just like the amazing dishes that you
have cooked and sent me photo so many of
you have makes a hollow Donuts or until
recently what a coincidence
I always feel good when I upload a video
and see you cook the same dish the next
days like these amazing crispy dumplings
if you like this video don't forget to
click like and subscribe to my channel
for more delicious Vietnamese kicks
thank you for watching
you
